meanings.definition: Below the level of a professional; not meeting the standards or requirements of a professional.
meanings.sent1: The subprofessional work was not up to the quality expected.
meanings.sent2: She hired a subprofessional painter to save money on the project.
meanings.sent3: The subprofessional attempt at baking a cake resulted in a kitchen disaster.
meanings.sent4: His subprofessional attitude towards his job cost him the promotion.
meanings.sent5: The subprofessional service left a lasting negative impression on the customers.

meanings.definition: A person who performs tasks or duties that do not require a high level of skill or training.
meanings.sent1: The company hired a subprofessional to handle basic administrative tasks.
meanings.sent2: As a subprofessional, he was responsible for cleaning the office every evening.
meanings.sent3: The subprofessional in the office always brought a smile with their cheerful attitude.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a subprofessional when asked to simply file papers all day.
meanings.sent5: The subprofessional's role was crucial in ensuring the smooth operation of the team.
